text:
Team Gully Boy is elated with the kind of response they have received in Berlin, where they were present for the premiere of their film. Actors Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt rocked the red carpet for world premiere of their film Gully Boy at the Berlin International Film Festival on Saturday.
Agencies
Also present were director Zoya Akhtar and producer Ritesh Sidhwani. While Ranveer was seen in a magenta animal print suit paired with a turtle neck tee, Alia donned a chic off-shoulder neon gown with a long trail and a side slit.
(Also read: Real Gully Boy Naezy Praises Reel Gully Boy Ranveer Singh, Appreciates His Hard Work)
Agencies
Talking to Reuters about the world premiere of Gully Boy, Ranveer said,
Agencies
Don't Miss 12.5 K SHARES 5.5 K SHARES 3.4 K SHARES 3.1 K SHARES 2.5 K SHARES
“I want this to be the beginning of something because I really think Hindustani hip-hop is a revolution. It’s more than just music. It’s a musical and social revolution. Traditionally our films and gender dynamics are structured very differently. So that’s an aspect of our film that we’re very proud of.”
(Also read: From Tupac To Eminem, Here's Every Rapper That Inspired Ranveer Singh To Prepare For Gully Boy)
Here are some more pictures and videos from the Berlin premiere of Zoya AKhtar's Gully Boy.
Agencies
Agencies
AGENCIES
Fans also took to their social media accounts to report that the tickets of the premiere got sold out in less than five minutes-which in itself is a big achievement.
Agencies
BTW the online tickets available for #GullyBoy premiere were sold out in 4 minutes post the tickets being available #Berlinale #craze #justsaying 😱❤️ — #Murad ✍🏽🎤 ka Cafe ☕️ (@ranveercafe69) February 7, 2019
Gully Boy is among the 400 films from around the world to be presented at the Berlin film festival. The film festival will take place from February 7 to 17, 2019.
(Also read: INDIA Is India Finally Waking Up To The Desi Underground Rap Scene With Ranveer Singh's Gully Boy? )
title: Alia-Ranveer's Gully Boy Gets A Big Thumbs Up In Berlin, Tickets Get Sold Out In 4 Mins Flat!
